text: was looking at something else when this came on, and immediately identified it as a Mitsuda composition. boy that guy has a recognizable style. which is a good thing because his style be STYLIN'

author: garfreeek

text: Funny how I hadn't even seen the name of the composer when I first listened to this, or even heard about the game at all but I knew right away that it was Mitsuda. This sounds just like Xenogears and Chrono Cross, this style of music is exactly the reason why he's one of my favorite composers.
author: Stephanie H

text: there hasnt been a tune of mitsudas i havent liked....its just a shame and downright criminal that he hasnt done any vg music in a while...which is sad cause these games nowadays could really use his work...
author: strifedavid

text: Nice music for an awful game...but hey there are plenty of examples of that on this list!
author: wiegraf9009

text: Nice! one of the best songs in the game 5/5
author: Underworld23

text:
Ah! I remember somewhere awhile back I recommended this track to you! Whether you checked it cause it's Mitsuda, cause I said something, or you've played the game, I must say this.
Can you see at all why I would recommend it? One of Mitsuda most unknown games he's worked with, but it's one of the best. The game is alright, but the soundtrack is out of this world. My personal favorite would HAVE to be Battle With The Devil.
author: Arc13

text: Okay...I just KNOW I've heard that flute melody right at the beginning somewhere else.
author: Trapster2

text: I thought this sounded a bit like Chrono Cross's OST.. then turns out this was composed by Yasunori Mitsuda himself!

text:

Always good to hear a track from the legend Mitsuda. But this track is just lacking.

text: As stated multiple times, once I hear the bass, I know it's Mitsuda. Also, Mitsuda has a knack for using a variety of percussion.
